item.title: Cycle lane is covered with leaves, 10th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 87, Blackfriars Road, Southwark, London

item.title: Rubbish carelessly thrown onto front of house, 10th November
item.description:
Over a month ago, my upstairs neighbors dumped an enormous amount of waste including furniture, boxes, and general rubbish. They obviously did not pay for the large waste collection, and it’s been piling up for weeks now. It’s unsightly, and beginning to cause distress in my house as I am trying to create a clean and calm environment for myself. It is very gross and i have to look at it every single day.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 202, Peckham Rye, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Still half the problem left behind!, 10th November
item.description:
Council team came to collect the dumped bags - but only took away half. Please remove the remaining bags - and please ask your council road cleaning team NOT to leave bagged leaves in the raised beds as it is attracting flytippers - plus is an eyesore.

item.title: Flitcroft Street, 10th November
item.description:
There are multiple cracks and dips in Flitrcroft Street that is allowing water to seep through and into the Phoenix Theatre. This is causing damage to the interior of the property including bubbling of the walls and a fast leak when there is heavy rain.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Flitcroft Street, Bloomsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet
